qas.question: By what name is the era in the 3rd millennium around 1500 BC known?
What events of significance to human development occurred during the Bronze Age ?

answers.text: people in the region were turning copper into bronze, growing rice

qas.question: What event evolving animals are the Myanmar also accredited with being the first to accomplish?
When did the Age of Iron begin?

answers.text: The Iron Age began around 500 BC

qas.question: What events punctuate the beginning of the Iron Age?

answers.text: with the emergence of iron-working settlements in an area south of present-day Mandalay

context: <a0_0>The Bronze Age<a0_0/> arrived circa 1500 BC when <a1_0>people in the region were turning copper into bronze, growing rice<a1_0/> and <a2_0>domesticating poultry and pigs<a2_0/>; they were among the first people in the world to do so. Human remains and artifacts from this era were discovered in Monywa District in the Sagaing Division. <a3_0>The Iron Age began around 500 BC<a3_0/> <a4_0>with the emergence of iron-working settlements in an area south of present-day Mandalay<a4_0/>. Evidence also shows the presence of rice-growing settlements of large villages and small towns that traded with their surroundings as far as China between 500 BC and 200 AD. Iron Age Burmese cultures also had influences from outside sources such as India and Thailand, as seen in their funerary practices concerning child burials. This indicates some form of communication between groups in Myanmar and other places, possibly through trade.
